availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William A. Shuck (Shelby County, KY, CSA captain. Henry Co prov govt conv rep)

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, resident and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John Young Shuck and Martha Lyle Shuck. Resident of Shelby County in 1850. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861. Served in the 8th Kentucky Regiment Cavalry (C.S.A.) as a first lieutenant from September 10, 1862, to March 1863 and captain from March 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 1, p. 290B.

Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0066.
